nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Broad marble pathways; wheelchairs can be accommodated
guided_tours: Local guides available; multilingual volunteers often assist
parking: Nearby paid public parking and private lots
nearby_amenities: Langar (free community kitchen), cafes, guesthouses, shops
special_notes: Central Sikh shrine; strict dress/head-covering rules; vegetarian-only langar

nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Paved pathways; some areas may have steps; wheelchair access partially possible
guided_tours: Local guides available
nearby_amenities: Cafés, shops, hotels and toilets in the area; very near to Golden Temple
special_notes: Site of the 1919 massacre; solemn memorial with preserved well and plaques

timings: Daily Beating Retreat (flag-lowering) usually at sunset
entry_fee: Small spectator seating/parking fees sometimes charged
nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: The venue has tiered spectator stands; some wheelchair-accessible sections but can be crowded
guided_tours: Many tour operators include Wagah in their Amritsar packages
parking: Official and unofficial parking near the border
nearby_amenities: Small food stalls and basic facilities on event days
special_notes: Highly patriotic, loud and theatrical; security protocols strict

nearest_bus: City bus stops in Amritsar centre
nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Located in city centre; pathways accessible; wheelchair access partial
guided_tours: Local guides and pilgrims’ groups commonly visit
nearby_amenities: Shops, eateries, hotels — plentiful in Amritsar
special_notes: Architecturally resembles Golden Temple but is a Hindu shrine

nearest_railway: Sri Anandpur Sahib railway station / Rupnagar (Ropar)
accessibility: Well-developed museum infrastructure; generally accessible
guided_tours: Museum has audio/guide options; local guides available
nearby_amenities: Hotels, guesthouses, restaurants, shops in Anandpur Sahib
special_notes: Modern museum dedicated to Sikh history and culture

accessibility: Museum building in town; generally accessible; some display areas may have steps
guided_tours: Local guides and archaeology students sometimes available
parking: Local street/lot parking available near museum
nearby_amenities: Basic eateries, shops and travel services in Rupnagar town
special_notes: Houses Harappan artifacts and regional finds

timings: Many sources mention day-time visiting hours (e.g., 09:00–17:00)
nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Wetland terrain; walking paths and boat rides; not all areas wheelchair friendly
guided_tours: Forest department/ local birding guides available
parking: Limited local parking at entry points
nearby_amenities: Few villages; basic eateries; better amenities in nearby towns
special_notes: Important stopover for migratory birds; protected wetland

accessibility: Urban fort site; some steps and uneven surfaces; partial wheelchair accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides available; heritage walks occasionally organized
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, hotels, markets in Bathinda city
special_notes: Historic Mughal/Ghaznavid/Regional fort

timings: Often open in daytime for visitors
accessibility: Palace grounds big; some halls may have steps and fragile flooring; wheelchair access partial
guided_tours: Local guides available; heritage walks and palace tours sometimes organized
nearby_amenities: Hotels, restaurants, shops in Patiala city
special_notes: Famous for royal architecture, mirror-work chambers

nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Urban temple with steps and crowded entrances during festivals; partial wheelchair accessibility
guided_tours: Local guides available
nearby_amenities: Shops, eateries, hotels in Jalandhar city
special_notes: One of the notable Shakti / Devi shrines in the region

entry_fee: Variable based on season and package
nearest_bus: Local bus routes to Lambra / Jalandhar outskirts
nearest_airport: Sri Guru Ram Dass Ji International Airport (Amritsar)
accessibility: Well-developed park paths; rides have specific height/health restrictions
guided_tours: Not applicable
nearby_amenities: Food stalls inside park, restrooms, lockers
special_notes: Popular family destination with dry rides and water attractions

timings: Open for devotees likely from early morning to evening
accessibility: Generally accessible; may have ramps at entrance
guided_tours: Local guides / Sikh pilgrimage tours include this
parking: On-site or nearby parking for devotees
nearby_amenities: Lodging / dharmshalas for pilgrims; basic food/langar
special_notes: One of the five Takhts in Sikhism

accessibility: Road access; scenic drive; steep or rugged terrain near some spots
guided_tours: Local tourism / lodging around dam often facilitate guided excursions
nearby_amenities: Cottages for stay, shops, eateries in nearby towns
special_notes: Hydroelectric project; large reservoir; scenic lake-side views

timings: Open early morning for prayers / kirtan etc
accessibility: Well-built complex; standard gurdwara design; wheelchair access Not documented
guided_tours: Many pilgrims visit; local guides may explain history
nearby_amenities: Langar hall, shops, eateries, lodging in Patiala city
special_notes: Known for its “eradicator of suffering” legend; sarovar (pond) has healing significance

timings: Gurdwara open for darshan throughout the day
accessibility: Slight uphill in parts of Anandpur; stairs in fort areas; wheelchair access possibly partial
guided_tours: Available through Sikh religious organizations and local guides
parking: On-site or nearby parking for pilgrims
nearby_amenities: Hotels & guesthouses in town; shops, langar halls; eateries
special_notes: One of the Five Takhts of Sikhism; birthplace of Khalsa Panth in 1699

timings: Open for darshan; special events around December
accessibility: Urban road access; large complex; may have many steps; partial wheelchair access likely
guided_tours: Local guides available; SGPC arrangements
nearby_amenities: Hotels and guesthouses in Sirhind; shops, eateries
special_notes: Martyrdom site of the younger sons of Guru Gobind Singh

timings: Many heritage buildings are viewable from outside
entry_fee: Some buildings may charge (museums) or allow free entry
nearest_airport: Amritsar International Airport or Chandigarh airport
accessibility: Within city; roads good; some heritage interiors might have stairs; wheelchair access may be limited
guided_tours: Local heritage walks / guides available
nearby_amenities: Hotels / guesthouses; restaurants; shops
special_notes: Known for its unique French / European style architecture

accessibility: Town road access; premises large; sarovar; steps in some older parts; partial wheelchair access likely
guided_tours: Part of pilgrimage circuits; local guides
nearby_amenities: Shops, eateries, lodging in Tarn Taran town
special_notes: Has the largest sarovar among gurudwaras; spiritual importance

accessibility: Wetland area; paths may be muddy; wheelchair access limited in wetlands
guided_tours: Nature / bird watching guides available locally
nearby_amenities: Basic facilities; small towns/villages nearby
special_notes: Biodiversity includes migratory water birds; scenic and quieter than big city sites

timings: Open for devotees; melas on Ashtami days (twice a year)
best_time: During melas (Ashtami; twice a year) or October-March
nearest_bus: Bathinda bus stands + route toward Mansa
accessibility: Road access; rural temple; during melas large crowds
guided_tours: Not typical; pilgrims travel independently
nearby_amenities: Small shops, food stalls during melas; lodging in Bathinda city
special_notes: Temple of Goddess Durga and Jwala Ji; strong mix of Hindu & Sikh devotees attend
